definition: to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to hide/to dodge/to avoid

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
surname Shan
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)

sentences.english: Eg. For the second time in her life she made an indirect answer.
sentences.chinese: 这是她有生以来第二次说话躲躲闪闪。

sentences.english: Pang shot an arrow at Guan who was unable to dodge it.
sentences.chinese: 庞德取箭，关羽躲闪不及中箭，回营养伤。

sentences.english: The sudden canting of the ship had made the deck no place for running on;
sentences.chinese: 船身突然倾倒使甲板上没有地方可以躲闪。

sentences.english: Mutilate, Backstab, Garrote and Ambush can no longer be dodged.
sentences.chinese: 毁伤，背刺，凿，伏击不再能被躲闪。

sentences.english: He ducked as the ball shot over his head.
sentences.chinese: 球从他头顶射过时他躲闪过去了。

sentences.english: This makes misses, dodges and parries a lot less painful.
sentences.chinese: 这使得未命中，躲闪，招架不那么让人痛苦。

sentences.english: I parried; but my hands were loath and cold.
sentences.chinese: 我想躲闪，但我的双手因寒冷已无法动弹。

sentences.english: The lonely man skulks down the main street all day.
sentences.chinese: 这个孤独的人整天在这条大街上躲躲闪闪。

sentences.english: It cannot be dodged, blocked or parried , and costs 10 runic power (for now).
sentences.chinese: 他不能被躲闪，招架，格挡，消耗10符文能量。

sentences.english: It cannot be dodged, blocked or parried , and costs 10 runic power (for now). Think Heroic Overrevenge.
sentences.chinese: 他不能被躲闪，招架，格挡，消耗10符文能量。

sentences.english: The sudden canting of the ship had made the deck no place for running on;
sentences.chinese: 船身忽然倾倒使甲板上没有地方可以躲闪。

sentences.english: Huang Chang wants to dodge being looked, meager the competence to act.
sentences.chinese: 黄裳想要躲闪，已是力不从心。

sentences.english: For the second time in her life she made an indirect answer.
sentences.chinese: 这是她有生以来第二次说话躲躲闪闪。

sentences.english: He was tickling the soles of her feet with his fingertips and she was flinching, but laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指尖轻轻挠着她的脚心，她在笑着躲闪。

sentences.english: With no time to dive out of the way, he leaped upward and sailed over the car’s hood.
sentences.chinese: 来不及躲闪的罗尼猛地一跃，跳至道奇车的引擎盖上。

definition: to dodge/to evade
to dodge/to sidestep
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
to step aside (for a passing vehicle)/to get out of the way/to make way for
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to jump out of the way
to get out of the way
to hit with a piercing blow
to hit back/to return fire
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to withdraw
to hide/to dodge/to avoid
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to escape/to flee/to run away
